title: GEORGIA, the historic cradle of wine
description:
*airline ticket not included  (for advice contact us)

 Arrival at night. Your guide will meet you at the airport. Transfer to your accommodation. For the duration of your trip to Georgia, full board is available (breakfast, lunch and dinner)

 

 

 Day 1

 

 Morning

 Rest

 

 Afternoon

 

Visit the capital of Georgia, discover the old city of Tbilisi. You will see the historical monuments like the church of Metekhi (XIII) and the sulphurous baths. All the interesting places are within walking distance of each other. A few steps through the city will introduce you to Georgian traditions and culture ...

 

 Evening

 

Visit the fortress of Narikala which offers a panormamic view of the city.

 

Night in Tbilisi.

 

 Day 2

 

 Morning

 

We continue the discovery of the capital. We will visit the National Museum of Tbilisi, where you will see unique archaeological and ethnographic artefacts,a 8000 years old jar with traces of wine. A rich heritage of the Christian culture, embroidery, gold and silver jewelry from ancient Colchis.

 

 

 

Afternoon

 

Departure for Kakhetie, region known for its vineyards. Telavi Tour:

 

-Visit of the Church of the Archangels, which dates back to the XVIth century, was built by King Leon of Kakheti. The red brick church retains centuries old frescoes.

 

-Visit Ikalto monastery, The monastery was founded in the sixth century by Zeno, one of the 13 Syrian fathers who evangelized Georgia it was one of the two largest academies in Georgia, an important center for the transmission of knowledge and science.

 

 Day 3

 

 Morning + noon:

 

Georgian wine tasting and traditional dishes at the Khareba Winery.

 

 Afternoon :

 

-Visit of Alaverdi Monastery: The monastery of Alaverdi is a Georgian Orthodox monastery. Some parts of the monastery were built during the 6th century. The current cathedral was built during the eleventh century.

 

The monastery was founded by the Assyrian monk Joseph Alaverdeli, who came from Antioch and settled in Alaverdi, then a small village and a center of the ancient pagan faith, being dedicated to the Moon. At the beginning of the eleventh century, the Kakhetian King Kvirike the Great built the cathedral now known as the Alaverdi Cathedral.

 

 

 Day 4

 

 Morning + noon:

 

Departure for Tsinandali. In the museum complex Tsinandali, you will discover the story of one of the most important families in Georgia, the Chavchavadzes. Enjoy the beauty of the decorative garden and admire the wine cellar of the nineteenth century, you will taste the wine "Tsinandali" created by the Chavchavadze family and other Georgian wines.

 

The Georgian wine was bottled for the first time in the historic winery of Tsinandali. Currently in the wine cellar, more than 16,000 bottles are kept, the oldest dating back to 1814.

 

 Afternoon :

 

Departure for Signaghi, one of the most beautiful cities of Georgia, overlooking the Alazani Valley. Signagi and its surroundings are home to several historical and cultural monuments and have been specifically protected by the state since 1975. The city is surrounded by remnants of 18th century fortifications. There are two Georgian Orthodox churches in the city itself - one dedicated to St. George and the other to St. Stephen. The venerated Bodbe Monastery is located 2 kilometers from Signagi and is a place of pilgrimage due to its association with St. Nino, the apostle of Georgiathat preached christianity during the IVth century.

 

 Day 5 and Day 6

 

 Departure for the Vashlovani National Park, remarkable for its unique areas of desert and semi-desert vegetation, arid steppe and forests, but also for its plains, cliffs and canyons, known locally as "sharp walls ".

 

 Day 7

 

 Morning:

 

Departure at 9 am for Tbilisi

 

 Afternoon :

 

Free time in Tbilisi

 

 Evening:

 

A party in a great Georgian restaurant will allow you to taste the delights and the unique atmosphere of the country.

 

At night you will be transferred to the airport of Tbilissi
